title: Simple and easy
comment: No fancy shmancy stuff here. Simple and handy.

title: Excellent flashlight app
comment: Does exactly what it's supposed to do without a bunch of extra crap or ads to get in the way.

title: Just what it says.
comment: Unfortunately I no longer need the app because lollipop has built in flashlight. But those of you using kitkat- , this is the torch app to go for. It's free, has no ads and it's open source, so it's guaranteed to not contain any malware

title: Works flawlessly
comment: I wish there was a flashlight widget I liked an I love the style, but the whole idea was sort of to get rid of unnecessary stuff, and it does that perfectly.

title: I'm totally behind the idea of this app…
comment: …but unfortunately, it does not work on my Nexus 5.

title: It's what it says on the tin, and only that.
comment: It's easy to access which is an important part of making something as useful as this great little app.  No ads, no pesky purchase, no unwanted bells and whistles.  Perfection. "There is no greatness where there is not simplicity, goodness, and truth." - Leo Tolstoy

title: Crashed Samsung Galaxy s3.
comment: The app repeatedly froze my phone, leaving the flash turned on. The only fix was to reboot. Uninstalled.

title: Perfect
comment: Love that it's open source, love that there are no ads, love that there's no extra crud, but most of all, I especially love that the screen is white with a single toggle switch in the middle (it doubles as a low-output flashlight when the LED isn't needed). No more waking up my wife with my flashlight when I'm trying to get ready in the mornings.

title: Update made it perfect
comment: I wish finding apps like this was easier!

title: Exactly what I was looking for!
comment: Works perfectly on Galaxy Ace 5839i      Very small file, no annoying ads, no useless "extra features". (Version 1.0.3)       Can be used minimised and with screen off, so no screen glare while using it.

title: Can't switch flash off
comment: Running it the first time it worked well, but on subsequent use I was unable to switch the flash off (Sony Xperia L).

Hey Theuns,
this should be fixed with the new version, I'm sorry for that.
The problem was the change of screen orientation, which I now just turned of.
Barebones perfection.  It's a flashlight and nothing more
